meanings.sent1: She accidentally overcured the cookies, making them too hard to eat.
meanings.sent2: It is important not to overcure the paint, or it will crack.
meanings.sent3: The chef overcured the steak, turning it into a tough leather shoe.
meanings.sent4: His attempt to overcure the problem only made it worse.
meanings.sent5: The sun overcured the clay, causing it to dry out too quickly.

meanings.sent1: The overcure of the meat made it too tough to chew.
meanings.sent2: The overcure of the wood caused it to become brittle and break easily.
meanings.sent3: The overcure of the glue made it impossible to separate the pieces.
meanings.sent4: The overcure of the concrete resulted in cracks forming all over the surface.
meanings.sent5: The overcure of the paint caused it to peel off in large chunks.
